Name: Kodekraker
Description:
This is a two player game.
Each player has a console on which he/she can set up a 6 digit code.
The goal is to guess the other players code first. You do this using cards the game provides.

—user summary

Name: Seven Waters
Description:
Seven Waters | a duel of pools

Anywhere, USA just re-zoned some land, and your dream of building a water park might finally come true! Just your luck, though, that someone else has the exact same idea. Two water parks! What a world. Guess you’ll just have to build a bigger and better one. Welcome to Seven Waters!

Overview
Seven Waters is a two-player card-drafting and placement game that can be played with a traditional deck of cards (jokers included). Snag cards from a shared tableau as you attempt to create the most appealing water park, filled with four slides, a lazy river, and a wave pool!

Each turn, you may either (1) draft an available card from a shared pyramid, or (2) play a card from your hand into your water park.  Build water slides by matching the ride value to the rope line value, build a wave pool with matching suits, build a lazy river with straight runs, and theme your park by choosing a bonus value suit.  Best park wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Craft & Conquer: Medieval
Description:
Craft and Conquer: Medieval is a fun and competitive game of conquest where you collect, craft, deploy and conquer other players in classic turn-based strategy gameplay.

Resources are gathered and used to build your armies which are deployed to achieve objectives while defending against or attacking your opponents’ units and settlements. The game is played in approximately 60 to 120 minutes depending on the number players and objectives in play.

To play the game, all players are given a number of objective cards to complete. The first player to complete that number of objectives ends the game. But be weary, he or she may
not be the actual winner. The player with the most points scored by the total value of their objective cards will become the “king of the land”.

—description from the designer

Name: Of Mines and Men: Roll and Write Edition
Description:
A mysterious roll and write, print and play game. Explore the mines, find treasures and discover the secret that lies beneath the surface.
Choose your favorite miner, gather resources, craft objects and get out of the mines in time... but beware! Dynamite is extremely dangerous and unstable.
The game includes:
Single player campaign
Multiplayer co-op
PVP
Paper clicker game mode

Single Player quick rules
GAME SETUP

     Choose the mission you want to play. It’s better to play them in order;
     Pick the game map related to the mission you chose;
     Choose your character wisely (the starting object may be crucial);
     Choose the entrance where you want to begin your adventure. Analyze carefully


the tasks that you must accomplish in order to complete the mission, it’s important to pick the best spot to start;

     The first turn begins. You have 16 turns to complete your mission and escape the mines. On the 17th turn, you lose the game. Don’t forget to mark the current spot in the progression bar placed at the bottom of the map.


TURN STRUCTURE
Movement: first, roll dice to determine the number of spots you can move. You can move in any direction, up to the number you obtained. If you roll 2 dice, you must choose one of the two results. You can use the other result to craft an object.
Action: once you’ve moved to the desired spot, check your Character Card to see the number of dice you can roll to perform actions. Both “Gathering” and “Extracting” have their own specific value that you must obtain to perform that specific action. You can use one or more dice to craft objects.
End of turn: once you’ve completed all your actions, mark the current spot of the progress bar at the bottom of the board. When you are in a “dynamite” spot, throw dice to determine where the explosion will block your way.

Name: That Tiles Game
Description:
That Tiles Game is an abstract game with Tiles (course) placement when you tried to match the most tiles posible to gain points. Also, you will try to keep the tiles of your opponents and snatch his points.

This game is visually  beautiful, with tiles tiles that resemble ornamental ceramic tiles.

—description from the designer

Name: 人狼 (JinRoh)
Description:
JinRoh, also known as JinRou (äººç‹¼), is a Japanese Mafia/Werewolf style game.

There will be 2 teams, villagers and werewolves, and a Host.  The Host, who is not on either team, is chosen to lead/moderate/narrate the game. The game alternates between Day and Night phases until the game is over.

Day Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to open their eyes and begin the first deliberations. A time limit may be established if desired. The goal is to determine The Werewolf and banish them from town. Players may “reveal” their identities and deliberate who they believe to be The Werewolf. LYING AND KEEPING SECRETS IS OKAY. The Host will call for all players to point at whom they want to banish. The player with the most votes is banished from the city and can no longer participate in discussions or nightly actions.
 Night Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to close their eyes. The Host calls one role at a time to perform their nightly action. The order proceeds as follows “Bodyguard, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to protect. Okay. Close your eyes.” “Werewolf, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to kill. Okay. Close your eyes.” (If there is more than one Werewolf, they will silently come to an agreement on ONE victim.) “Prophet, open your eyes and point at one person to see their identity. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person is human or werewolf) Okay. Close your eyes.” “Necromancer, open your eyes. You may see the identity of the person who was last banished. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person was human or werewolf). Okay. Close your eyes.”
Unless they are protected by The Bodyguard, the Werewolf’s victim is killed and removed from the game.
 The Human Team wins when all Werewolves are banished from the town. The Werewolf Team wins when the number of remaining Humans is reduced to the number of remaining Werewolves.

Name: Le jeu des Armées
Description:
One of the few pre-WWII wargames from Belgium. Featuring a board on heavy card stock with various terrain features and a superimposed grid for movement of units. Playing pieces (of wood) representing artillery, infantry and other units. Each unit has a value on the bottom to represent the impact of capture.

—user summary

Name: Dragoborne: Izarco-Tvash Promo Card
Description:
This is a red creature (dragon) promo card for the Dragoborne: Rise to Supremacy card game.

This card has an attack value of 6 and an endurance (HP) of 6. The cost to play this card is 7.

The non-promo version has some benefits that this card does not have. Specifically, this card:

When entering the game


     Does not do damage immediately. This card only does damage during the combat phase.
     Only 1 opposing card takes damage. You cannot spread the damage across multiple opposing creatures.  
     Does not allow a player to change the value of one of his/her die to 6. 


When destroyed

The card is removed from the game but no damage is dealt to the other player.

Name: Dragoborne: Dragolord's Intervention Promo Card
Description:
This was given for October Shop Tournament Participation. The card is a yellow spell (light) promo card for the Dragoborne: Rise to Supremacy card game.

This spell allows the player to draw 3 cards. If the player has a yellow banner, the cost to play this card (6) is reduced by 2 for every 1 shown on the player's dice.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Moroch
Description:
On the world of Moroch, Imperial forces make desperate preparations to withstand the coming of heretic invaders. The frontier world is being braced as part of vast defensive strategies in an attempt to hold the Nachmund Gauntlet – a solitary route through the madness of the Great Rift. Yet the taint of Chaos is already upon Moroch, and it runs deep – traitors amongst the Imperial forces' ranks rise to strike from within. Few can be spared from the preparations for the looming war to hunt down these heretic cells, and now all that stands between the Militarum Traitoris warbands of Blooded and their total victory is an elite Phobos Strike Team of deadly Space Marines.

Kill Team: Moroch is the third full expansion box for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, the ultimate sci-fi skirmish game. It includes miniatures for two complete new kill teams, the covert Adeptus Astartes Phobos Strike Team, and the heretical traitor guardsmen of the Blooded – as well as transfers, a double-sided game board, a full set of terrain, and a new rule manual featuring missions, background material, and full rosters for both the two Kill Teams and Moroch itself.

In this box you'll find:

1x 96 page Kill Team: Moroch Rules manual: take the fight to the corrupted world of Moroch, a key defensive point in the Nachmund Gauntlet, with background material for this stronghold world and the forces that clash over it. This manual also includes new rules, datacards, and background tables for the Phobo Strike Team and Blooded kill teams, as well as additional killzone rules and Shadow Operations missions set on this war-torn planet.

23x Citadel miniatures: Two full kill teams, including miniatures available for the first time in this box, each featuring a wide array of customisation and alternate assembly options. Extra components allow for deep personalisation of your kill team, and many models can be assembled as multiple different kinds of operative.

Phobos Strike Team:
- 10 Primaris Space Marines which can be built as Infiltrators or Incursors, with an extra sprue of upgrades and a mine marker – customise your kill team to complete your mission
- Extra components to build specialists like the Commsman, Helix Adept, Saboteur, Voxbreaker, Marksman, Minelayer, and Veteran
- Full transfer sheet with over 270 markings and emblems

Blooded Kill Team:
- 12 Blooded warriors to tear down the rotting edifice of the Imperium. 10 of these miniatures are available for the first time in this boxed set, and are accompanied by a Traitor Enforcer and a Traitor Ogryn, previously found in Blackstone Fortress: Traitor Command
- Includes components to build specialists like the Brimstone Grenadier, Butcher, Trench Sweeper, Flenser, Corpseman, Sharpshooter, and more

8x Fronteris terrain pieces: Recreate the rugged, mass-produced fortifications of Moroch on your tabletop. This assemblage of modular terrain pieces can be configured in any number of ways to create a varied killzone for your kill teams to sneak around and clash over, and is fully compatible with a wide range of other terrain kits. It includes:
- 1x Landing Pad
- 1x Vox-Antenna
- 1x Auspex Shrine
- 1x STC Hab-Bunker
- 1x Stockades with Doors
- 3x Stockades

1x Double-sided Fronteris game board: Battle over the war-torn outposts of Moroch on this double-sided 30" x 22" folding cardboard game board.

You'll need a copy of Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team Core Book to make full use of this supplement.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Slaanesh Sybarites
Description:
The Hedonites of Slaanesh revel in the brutal carnage of battle, giving praise to the God of Excess and indulging in their every whim. They can be found throughout the Mortal Realms, and their presence in the Eightpoints has a malign influence on the mortal cultists who fight for survival in that blasted wasteland. They seek out combat not only for the thrill of battle but also to impress these mortal warriors with the virtues of their god.

With more ranged warriors than any other warband, the Sybarites can keep their enemies at arm’s length until they choose to unleash their frightening martial prowess in the swirl of melee combat. Though few in number, their warriors are skilled and versatile. When used well, they can eviscerate their opponents, but their lack of armour means you have to hold back until the moment is right to spring your traps. The kit includes a mix of heavily armoured elite warriors that will carve through even the toughest fighters, along with loads of archers. You’ll also find fighter cards to bring along Seeker cavalry, Slaangors, and mortal heroes.

Contents:
16 Miniatures
  â€£ 5 Myrmidesh Painbringers OR Symbaresh Twinsouls
  â€£ 10 Blissbarb Archers (1 can be built as a High Tempter)
  â€£ 1 Blissbrew Homonculus
Hedonites of Slaanesh Wound Divider and Abilities Cards
19 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens
10 Round Bases (28.5mm)
5 Round Bases (32mm)
1 Round Base (25mm)

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Daughters of Khaine
Description:
Twisted followers of the God of Murder, the Daughters of Khaine combine aelven prowess with shadowy abilities and strange mutations.

If you desire nothing more than to dance a trail of destruction through the Eightpoints, spilling blood in the name of Morathi, this is the warband for you. With no fewer than 20 types of fighter to choose from, you’ll be ready to take on everything the Dark Gods can throw at you. Not only can you build the monstrous Blood Sisters and Blood Stalkers, plus Witch Aelves and Sisters of Slaughter, you’ll also find fighter cards for many of the Daughters of Khaine models.

The Daughters of Khaine are one of the fastest, hardest-hitting warbands in the game, and they can be tailored to very specific play styles. Of course, you’ll also be able to use all these models in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar forces, making it a great buy for existing players to bolster their collection or anyone looking to start up a new army.

Contents:
15 Miniatures
  â€£ 5 Melusai Blood Sisters OR Melusai Blood Stalkers
  â€£ 10 Witch Aelves OR Sisters of Slaughter
5 Round Bases (40mm)
10 Round Bases (25mm)
Daughters of Khaine Wound Divider and Abilities Cards
20 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens

Name: Go Ahead Punk!
Description:
1970's San Francisco. A City Under Siege.  A Maniac Sniper is on the loose… Codename – Stinger. 
Killing at random, he doesn’t want money. He’s enjoying himself.

Standing in his way, three of SFPD’s finest. Their task, to close the net while there’s still time. 
They must stop the killing or, as a last resort, prevent his escape.

Inspired by classic 70’s cop cinema, Go Ahead Punk is a One vs All hidden movement game of cat and mouse stealth and all guns blazing action!

For 1-4 players, one player takes on the role of the Sniper using hidden movement to sneak around the streets of San Francisco.  The cards he draws will determine where he has access to take a shot before making his escape.

The other players take on the role of the cops, using their individual skills to help track down Stinger; 
Brannigan the uncompromising cop with a powerful 44 magnum, Johnson the combat specialist with the ability to re-roll dice and Lacey the intel specialist with an instinct for playing the right hunch.

When the cops find Stinger, combat breaks out as they try to take him down.  
From six-shooter to rocket launcher, players use whatever weapons they've been able to lay their hands on. 
If the cops exhaust their health, they're taken to the ER to heal. (no player elimination)

Stinger must complete 3 hit's and escape the city to win, but if he runs out of health, it's victory for SFPD!

Name: Ultra Quick College Baseball
Description:
This year book contains all of the college teams from 2021 in Divisions I,II, III,the NAIA, all three divisions of Junior College Baseball, and the CCCAA. There are 1300+ teams rated in this year book. The Year Book also includes a SOS system, so you can match up any team realistically.

The purpose of this game is to quickly simulate scores and standings for baseball leagues.  You can use the game as a companion to a play-by-play baseball game, or as a stand-alone game in which you play out the season and watch the pennant races unfold.
 Each team is accurately rated for their hitting, pitching and defense as well as how they perform when playing at home and how they handle pressure situations.  The combination of these ratings gives you a very accurate picture of each team.  In addition to the team ratings, we also provide you with a quick and simple method for normalizing teams across eras.  So, you can effortlessly determine the best team of all time if you choose, without worrying about any biases.

Name: SANDANNOTOU
Description:
SANDANNOTOU is a trick-taking game for exactly 3 players.

The game includes a board showing most of the ranks of the cards around the border of an octagonal board, and lines connecting each of the values. During setup, players draft placing towers onto spaces created by the intersecting lines or on a person sheet.

The cards played to a trick will generally form a triangle on the board.  Any towers within a trick's triangle gain a token if the owner followed suit and loses one if they did not.

After all cards have been played, the game ends.  Each token on a tower is worth 1 point, unless the tower has 4 token; towers with 4 tokens are worth no points.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: 珠霊祭の夜 (Syureisai No Yoru)
Description:
In ç éœŠç¥­ã®å¤œ (Tama Tamamatsuri No Yoru), roughly Night of the Pearl Festival, the players are buying and selling gems through a mancala mechanism.

Each player has a board divided into six sections, one for each of the colors of gems.  On their turn, a player choose all of the cubes in one section, picks them up, and distributes them as in mancala.

The color of the space where the last cube is placed and the number of cubes there determines the actions a player may take.  Specifically, the color of gem they can buy or sell and the maximum number they can buy or sell.

After the distribution occurs, a market adjustment card is triggered from a face up pool which likely adjusts the value of a single colored gem up one, but may trigger a more volatile move.

The game ends after a number of times through an event deck or when a player has accumulated a certain amount of money.  The players each get the same number of turns and the one with the most money wins.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Darkoath Savagers
Description:
Darkoath Savagers are legendary for their strength and martial prowess, which they use to fulfil the pacts and prophecies that drive them across the Mortal Realms. To break these vows is the foulest of crimes, and a sign of terrible weakness – such cowards don't last long, among their own ranks or those of their rivals. Guided by the dire visions of God-speaker priests, Darkoath warbands venture forth to prove their mettle and win the favour of the Ruinous Powers.

Strap on your boots, grab the heaviest weapon you can lift, and get ready to mangle your foes with the Darkoath Savagers.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tarantulos Brood
Description:
The Tarantulos Brood worship Chaos in the form of the Eightfold Watcher, a bloated cosmic spider, and seek out mutagenic substances like varanite to uplift their mortal forms ever-closer to the sacred shape of their god. The Tarantulos act as an eerie psychic gestalt, communing with the spiders they keep like livestock, and bear weapons and garments created from the byproducts of their arachnid companions.

Scuttle forth from your subterranean homes to ensnare your foes with the Tarantulos Brood.

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare Astoundingly Awesome Tales – Chapter 1
Description:
You want a peaceful life, full of fun, laughter, and care-free living? You want a white picket fence and inviting the neighbors round for a pool party? You want modern living and conveniences, with friendly robots and cute critters? Well, you’ve come to the wrong place!

The Wasteland is a hip shooting, rough riding, danger around every corner kind of place, and you have only your (semi) trusted allies to help. It’s death gauntlets and killer cyborgs. It’s planting a flag for you and yours and raiding the resources of them and theirs. It’s high-octane, all-out war for even a scrap of usable land. It’s ruined cities, it’s desolate wastelands, it’s military bases and patched settlements.

It’s all yours for the taking, for as long as you can. You want easy living? You should have stayed in the vault, because your tale won’t be Astoundingly Awesome without getting your hands dirty.

This astonishingly action-packed 52-page expansion for the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare miniatures game includes an abundant assortment of scenarios that can be played individually or linked together into five three-part mini-campaigns. Astoundingly Awesome Tales Chapter 1 also includes optional supporting material that can be used for either solo or versus games, and amazingly atmospheric narrative suggestions that help to ground your forces in the battlefield and provide motivation for the factions involved.

Name: Rapture: Climate
Description:
You can control many things in the battle, but the forces of nature remain unpredictable.

Expose your battlegroups to the elements with the Climate Add-On and put their will to survive to the test under the most inhospitable conditions. Choose a season, location, and time of day for your game, and customize each game using a multitude of combinations of weather conditions and dangerous environmental impacts. Nightly skirmishes on a storm-battered seashore or icy cold snow storms in the middle of a city? Uncertain times are brewing.

—description from the publisher

Name: Munahhemana: The Chosen One
Description:
With the Lord of the heavens and the earth echoing the commands to the Holy Prophet (PBUH), a divine revelation came about 1400 years ago. This advent had been promised in the Abrahamic religions, including Christianity. His name was "the Chosen One" and has been narrated in various languages throughout history. The name commenced its journey from the ancient Syriac language with Munahhemana (Ü¡Ü¢ÜšÜ¡Ü¢Ü), passed by Greek with Periclutos (περικλυτος) and then landed in the Gospel of John with Paraclete. This name has since remained in the hearts and minds of generations to come. In the Gospel of John, the Prophet Jesus (PBUH) said, "I am announcing the coming of someone who, if I do not leave you, will not come… “He will teach you everything and recollect what I have told you”… “When he comes he will bring justice and equity to the world". Ultimately, the Chosen One, named Muhammad (PBUH), appeared in the Arabian Peninsula. He, along with his companions, migrated to Medina to build the Abrahamic civilization.

Munahhemana needs citizens who will help him build the new civilization with their production and economics, dedication and obedience, intelligence and politics, and science and wisdom. In the Game of Munahhemana, various challenging events and important missions occur. Herein, only tribes with specific characteristics can support Munahhemana. They must find the balance between the strengthening of their tribes’ power and carrying out missions assigned to them.

ROUTINE, CO-OP or SOLO. You can choose and play any of these three modes. In routine mode, you compete with other players, while in co-op mode, you collectively work together, and finally, in solo mode, you work alone to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Viticulture World: First Game Continent Promo Pack
Description:
Ease into the cooperative challenge of the Viticulture World expansion with this first-game promo pack. This is completely optional and only available from Stonemaier Games.

Contains 9 cards.

Name: O'Tali's Bizaare
Description:
O'Tali's Bizaare is a culmination of shops, inn's, gambling dens, hired guns, and more! The vendors in O'Tali's Bizzare either thrive in the chaotic ebb and flow of the bizarre or owe the Merchant's Guild a debt. These same vendors often travel outside the safety of the bizarre to find rare resources, priceless artifacts, or slay great beasts to make unique items sell in their shops. The market is competitive, and vendors must do whatever it takes to stay in demand.

Gameplay:

O'Tali's Bizaare is a engine building RPG were players try to gain the most from their sales, over a limited set of rounds. The day/night cycle gives players a wide array of actions to take and ways to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Anunnaki: Dawn of the Gods – Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Kickstarter edition of Anunnaki: Dawn of the Gods includes the base game, Journey of the Gods, Fall of the Gods, and Origins of the Gods all packaged in the same large box.

Fall of the Gods consists of two modules and two sets of exclusive components, designed to make each game different from the last.
Mythological creatures: Introduces new units, each with its own powers, which you can obtain in the course of the game.
Asymmetric setup: New rules and components to be able to change the starting setup.
Special artifacts: Two new artifacts.
Nyponnis House: A new House with a unique play style.

Origins of the Gods:
A narrative campaign with 8 replayable scenarios and 7 asymmetrical reward sets to the core game.

Journeys of the Gods consists of two modules an one set of exclusive components, designed to make each game different from the last.
Distant planets: Introduces new planets to be explored and new game modes.
5th player: Rules and components for playing with 5 players.
Mesos House: A new House with a unique play style.

Name: Hangman: Einstein Edition
Description: Classical Hangman Game with 160 words. There is a paper with two possible words. The player(s) choose 1 or 2 and the game master player for this round split of part with the words. Now the player(s) can for example choose an „e“ and the game master can tell them that it is on 1,3,6. It’s easy because under every letter is a short number so you can directly say the position. Quick good vacation game.

Name: Khârn-Âges
Description:
Khârn-Âges is a Fantasy skirmish miniatures wargame in which you lead a Spearhead (name given to your team of miniatures). These Spearheads are composed of anthropomorphic animals of 54mm (this is a guideline, many species are larger, including Tembos that sometimes reach 170mm!!!).

The same miniature can correspond to several profile levels, and you can equip it as you wish, so you have the possibility to play it with different characteristics while changing its weapons and equipment, or to have access to many different spells for the magicians.

Khârn-Âges is a scenario game, it's not about "wiping-out" your opponent (even if it's possible sometimes!), but about fulfilling your objectives to win. Playable on 60x60 cm, a whole series of immersive scenarios are usable in the rulebook.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Thunderbirds Danger Zone: The Game
Description:
Based on the classic British sci-fi television series, Thunderbirds: Danger Zone is a fast-paced cooperative family card game.

Send the International Rescue Team out into the Danger Zone on daring rescues and bring them home safely to Tracy Island. Players collaborate to bring fuel, weapons, knowledge and team spirit efficiently into the game under the expert guidance of Jeff Tracy.

Using characters and missions from the original TV series, players work as a team to avert disasters worldwide and beyond. Players take turns as Jeff, deciding what resource needs to be deployed and where. Players might use their cards to help get the right amount of fuel Scott needs for a rescue or to deliver the tools and gadgets needed by Lady Penelope to chase The Hood. Only Jeff can make the changes needed to ensure success. Every moment counts and if the numbers don't add up vital time will be lost. Can you work as a member of the International Rescue Team, save those in peril and bring everyone home safely?

Components: 110 cards, 90 tokens, game rules
Box size: 180 x 130 x 40 mm

—description from the publisher

Name: Match Madness Duo
Description:
Shift your brain into higher gear in this clever game of logic and perception. Be quick to recreate a pattern on a card with your set of 5 blocks! Perfect dual fun for up to 2 players!

Flip the top card from the playing deck and reveal a pattern card. The first player to successfully match the pattern grabs the card and shows their block configuration to their opponent.

The player with the most card at the end wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Siege of Mantua
Description:
Two armies march to the relief of the fortress and its exhausted garrison. One from the East, and one from the North, converging on the outnumbered enemy. That enemy was the Army of Italy, the first field command of Napoleon Bonaparte. The fifteen days that followed would make him a legend.

Taking as its subject Bonaparte's famous Arcole campaign, Siege of Mantua is a game of operational maneuver and tactical daring. Players move blocks on the mapsheet to threaten and deceive their opponent, with the object of bringing them to a decisive battle. These are fought on a battle display with counters drawn randomly from your unit pool. The quality of your pool improves with every victory; suffering losses will damage morale, degrading unit quality.

You must master both of these spheres if you wish to be victorious. Though outnumbered, the French player has the benefit of moving along interior lines, allowing greater coordination of forces. But those men are stretched thin to deal with two distinct lines of enemy advance. The Austrian player can use this to their advantage, bringing superior forces to bear at weak points in the enemy line. What results is a desperate battle of wits and nerve, and a novel take on the "block game" genre.

-description from publisher

Name: Dystopia
Description:
In Dystopia, zombies, tsunamis, viruses, atomic explosions threaten all continents.
Who among you will succeed in eliminating as many dangers as possible from their continent to save humanity?
Observation, memorization, deduction, cunning and strategy will be your best allies to win the game.
The goal: to have as few dangers as possible on his threatened continent to get out of it!

Each player chooses a continent.
On his turn either he takes the first card from the discard pile, or he takes the first card from the draw pile.

If he chooses a card face up he must swap it with a card from his deck and place it face up.

If he chooses a card from the draw pile, he chooses whether he keeps it or not.

If, at the end of his turn, a player thinks he has a minimum number of danger points, he announces "Dystopia", which triggers the last turn, then the players reveal their cards and count the points.

Name: Infinity N4: Rules Annex
Description: The Infinity N4 Rules annex is an annex to the Infinity N4 ruleset containing a series of rules, special skills, weapons, and pieces of equipment which have been adapted to the N4 system, but with a provisional nature. The annex includes rules for fireteams, new special skills, weaponry, and equipment.  Rules included here are completely official, however they may be modified in further expansions of the N4 ruleset.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Spell Out!
Description:
Spell Out! is an all-new word game from Next Dimension Games.  Wordplay challenges meet area-control gameplay as 1-4 players race to claim words on the board before their opponents, blocking other players' moves on the way and claiming bonuses wherever possible.  Choose your words wisely - the game depends on it!

Play starts by revealing a challenge card, for example 'words with the blend CK' and each come up with a 5-letter word that fits, e.g. cloCK.  Players then take it in turns to move their pieces on the board, aiming to line them up with all the letters in their word and declare "Spell Out!" before their opponents can do the same.

Letters on the outer ring win you a bonus token if you can get them into a word, and you can exchange it later for an extra turn, but beware! Spent tokens are claimed by opponents, potentially handing them a very useful extra move!

With bounce spaces for advanced movement strategies, randomised start positions and two difficulty levels of cards, Spell Out is the always-fresh word game for families and groups of all ages, skilful wordsmiths and seasoned gamers alike.

Spell Out also includes a Solo Challenge Mode and multiple optional play variants.

-description from designer

Name: Jumping Jack
Description: Each player has five matching "Jacks" which are shot from spring-loaded launchers onto one of five plastic towers. The round ends when all ten jacks have been shot (you can knock off your opponent's pieces). Round score is calculated and the highest score after five rounds wins.

Name: Hová bújtál, katica?
Description:
The beetles that live in flower meadows are in great danger. A hungry bird could fly by at any moment and, if it spots them, it could eat them. But the beetles have learned how to become almost invisible in the grass. Help them hide too!

A fun development board game that's great fun for younger children, so the whole family can play together.

The aim of the game is for each player to collect and hide 4 beetles under the grass. Since the beetles are different sizes, the plants that hide them are also different sizes. The ladybird can be hidden by the smallest grass, while the potato beetle can be hidden by the medium size and the deer beetle by the largest.

Name: 复苏：破封 (Recovery: Break the Seal)
Description:
The Resuscitators resuscitate in this era. The Human Restart Seal Array attempts to reseal the Resuscitators. After the Resuscitator noticed the seal formation, they decided to lead the army to attack the city. The City Manager only needs to defend the city to win.

å¤è‹ï¼šç ´å° ("Recovery: Break the Seal")is an asymmetrical two-player card game. One player playing The Resuscitators use rule like Smash Up. Other player playing The City Manager use DBG rule against The Resuscitator.

The Resuscitators must defeat the battlefield within a limited time to win. Conversely, the City Manager only needs to hold to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle Of The Breweries
Description:
Battle Of The Breweries Season 1 Card Game is a fast paced and strategic game, that pits rival breweries against each other.

The worlds first Trading Card game featuring real world breweries and beers.
130 breweries are a part of Season 1 from 30 countries!

Take control of a world renowned brewery as a brand new co-owner!
Your first task? Build the greatest taproom in the world for your fans to flock to.
Along the way, you'll have to source beers within your fans favourite ABV% range, stock beers that are linked to your brewery, find the glassware that compliments your beers and locate your breweries Pet or Mascot.
It all sounds too easy, but your rivals have decided to copy your plans. You won't know who they are or what they're trying to source themselves, and you'll have to defend yourself from thieves and attackers that are out to steal your items.

It's time to fight your way to glory and become the greatest brewery in the world!


    Includes the Trading Cards of 15 breweries inside, along with everything you need to take on your rival breweries in a strategic, fast paced and exciting game.


—description from the designer

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Saturn 2101
Description:
This is a solo and duo expansion!

Released in July 2022, one more city is becoming black each round!

Tips: Wrap around and use the Wind Action!

Will you be able to deliver all colored cubes before the end of the game ? If you liked on the Moon, you will love on Saturn 2101!

—description from the publisher

Name: Love Battle! High School: Our Powers Combine! Promo Cards
Description: A set of 5 promotionals card that require a pairing of two set characters in the same room to activate. Released in the 2022 Convention season.

Name: 八雲さんはトリテしたい (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai)
Description:
å…«é›²ã•ã‚“ã¯ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†ã—ãŸã„ (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai), roughly translated as "Yakumo wants to play a trick-taking game", is a trick-taking game for 1 to 4 players themed around eyeglasses.

The game includes a board which pictures a pair of glasses with spaces around it for players' pieces.  The winner of a trick chooses a card from the trick and advances their marker a number of spaces corresponding to the rank. The different spaces are worth a different number of points.

Additionally, the 0 card causes each token to immediately advance 1 space.

The game can be played for one hand or over a series of hands.  In both methods of scoring, the winner will be the one who best maximizes the point value of where the piece is on the glasses board when the hand ends.

Name: Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures
Description:
Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures is an exciting big expansion for Chronicles of Avel, in which players will once more become heroes and heroines with an epic quest to help the magical land of Avel. The game introduces 3 thematic scenarios which can be played separately or as a campaign and 3 modules that can be used in different combinations to create personalized challenges. Players will have to cooperate to choose the best strategy, support each other and win.

In Chronicles of Avel: New Adventures players will continue exploring the world of Avel, using modular board created from hexagonal tiles. New place tiles, equipment, monsters and a new Beast will give opportunity to tell new stories in a much more immersive way. This expansion is an answer to requests made by players - containing all necessities to make Chronicles of Avel even better!

—description from the publisher

Name: King of Tokyo: Even More Wicked!
Description:
Introduced in the Dark collector's edition of King of Tokyo, now you can add the Wickedness Gauge to ALL your King of Tokyo games!

This expansion includes the Wickedness board, 10 Wickedness tiles and all 15 counters representing every monster in the King of Tokyo base game and expansions.

In addition to Victory Points, 1's and 2's grant you Wickedness Points as follows:


     For each three-of-a-kind of 1's, gain 2 Wickedness Points;
     For each three-of-a-kind of 2's, gain 1 Wickedness Points;


Track any points gained by moving your Monster counter up the Wickedness Gauge.

If your counter moves onto or beyond the 3 , 6 or 10 space, you may take a tile of your choice from the tiles available at that Wickedness level.

—description from the designer

Name: Sports Dice: Soccer
Description:
Roll your way to victory with Sports Dice Soccer!

Sports Dice Soccer is a fast paced, easy to learn and quick to play dice game that gives players all the action of a real Soccer game. Roll your dice and kick the ball in the opponent’s net to score! The first player with 3 points wins the game.

Sports Dice Soccer is an ideal game for all Soccer fans ages 7 and up. It is the latest addition to the Sports Dice’s series.

—description from the publisher

Name: Απίθανοι Ήχοι (Incredible Sounds)
Description:
A game for children who are called to recognize sounds that are being played to them by the provided two CDs. They are then marked by token on boards and on the end the one who has identified the most sounds correctly wins!

—user summary

Name: ツミカブリ(Tsumikaburi)
Description:
It's been a long time, dear magicians. Welcome to the auction hall where demons dance with malicious intent. This time you need all eight demons in your possession to complete the dark ritual. Don’t worry if you don’t collect them all this time, you’ll get another chance. As long as you collect more than the other magicians, you will get out of here alive.

ãƒ„ãƒŸã‚«ãƒ–ãƒª(Order of Sin) is a bidding and deckbuilding game where you try to collect Demon Cards. Every player starts with the same deck of cards. All you have to do every turn is lay down a card from your hand and point to the card you want.

The important question is whether you and another player point to the same card. If only one player points to a card, they acquire it without revealing their bid. If multiple players point to the same card, they reveal their cards to decide the winner. Some revealed cards also activate special effects.

At the end of the game, the winner is the player who holds the largest number of different Demon Cards in their hand.

Name: Rechenkoenig In Den Vier Rechenarten
Description:
Math learning game with plastic number pieces and plastic board with basic math calculations, with holes to fit the right numbers.

At the start of the game plastic pieces are randomly distributed evenly to the players. Player with the number one piece starts the game by putting it to it's place in the leftmost space in uppermost line. After that player who has the next correct piece places it to the next open space. If you can fill the last space in the line, then you can give every other player one of your pieces. The player who'll first get rid of all of their pieces is the winner.

—user summary

Name: burncycle: Promo Missions
Description: This set contains 4 promo missions for burncycle, one per corporation, and can be obtained as a reward for resolving the burncycle lore recruitment portfolio riddle.

Name: two seesaws
Description:
two seesaws is a trick-taking game for 1 to 5 players.  The card play is a standard "must-follow" game.  There are a series of cards which determine how the trick is resolved.

Two "SEE/SAW" cards determine half of the trump suit, the orientation the winner of a trick places it in, and will be flipped to its opposite side if a black card wins the current trick.

Two "HIGH/LOW" cards determine if low numbers or high numbers win the trick, and will be flipped to its opposite side if a red card wins the trick.

The combination of the two cards in play form a single suit icon which specifies the trump suit.

At the end of each hand, players will earn points for alternating winning SEE and SAW tricks, or something similar to that.  Unpaired SEE or SAW tricks will lose a player points.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Green Team Wins: Gaming Community Promo Pack
Description:
Collection of 30 cards for use in the game. There are 10 different new cards in each of the three categories. All of the cards are related to board gaming.

The card content was created through a collaboration with: Gaming with Sidekicks, One Board Family, Board Game Spotlight, and Tantrum House.

—description from the publisher

Name: Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #13: ASL Scenario Pack for Winter Offensive 2022
Description:
ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #13 (2022) features four new scenarios (WO39-WO42) using deluxe-style maps as well as three new deluxe-style maps (m, n, o).

Proceeds from sales benefit the WWII Foundation.

Name: The Post of the Past and at Present
Description:
Typical roll and move game about the post delivering history around the world (from Europe, Asia, North America, Africa).
The first player, who cross the route with 41 stops first, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Escape Game: Die Pyramide des Pharao
Description: A game with cards and many puzzles waiting to be solved so that the pyramid can be left - just like in a real Escape Room! A journey through history; full of puzzles that help develop logical skills, mathematical thinking, observation skills and language. The cards hide useful clues to continue the adventure and exit the pyramid. The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Name: Escape Game: Das verfluchte Schloss
Description:
On a school trip you visit a castle. As soon as you enter, all the doors close and you are trapped in the castle. Now you have to find the exit together.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Name: Escape Game: Das Labor des Dr. Frank
Description:
Aliens have abducted you while you were searching in space for new planets where humans could live. Now you are locked in the cockpit of your spaceship: Try to free yourself and return to Earth!

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Name: Escape Game: Abenteuer in London
Description:
The legendary secrets of the breathtaking metropolis of London are finally to be uncovered. For this, you are needed as an investigator! Explore every corner of the mysterious city and solve the numerous tricky puzzles and secrets you encounter along the way. Only in this way will there be an escape at the end to pass the exciting adventure.

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Name: Kampfgeschwader vorwärts!
Description:
Military strategy game based on aerial bombing raids. One of many propaganda-based wargames published in Nazi Germany before WWII.

The board is on heavy cardstock and depicts various terrain features with a superimposed grid for movement of units.

The game comes with 28 toy figures made of tin: 20 aircraft (6 twin-engine bombers and 4 fighters for each player) and 8 anti-aircraft guns (4 for each player). There are also 12 round paper counters (6 for each player). Each unit has a value on the bottom to represent the impact of capture.

—user summary

Name: Escape Game: Das geheimnisvolle Museum
Description:
You have just arrived at a museum when suddenly the lights go on and off continuously.... and the windows open and close without you being able to hold them. You look for the exit, but realise that the museum is a veritable labyrinth of rooms and corridors: You are lost!

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

Name: Gerrymander
Description:
Players will be a politician and they will be gerrymandering the board. The player with the most district wins.
This turn-based game introduces the concept of gerrymandering in the most relevant way. These days, the game is highly sensitive, and there is a need to educate more people about the repercussions of democracy

The players will start with some cash to purchase the corruption cards to change and manipulate the voters on the board. Once the players finish their money in the campaign phase, they will start the gerrymander phase with the district pieces they purchase in the campaign phase.

—description from the designer

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Santa Gor
Description:
The Santa Gor is an official free print & play bonus hero for the Legends of Andor base game and its expansions. He can carry almost no items, but leaves a free gift for the other heroes whenever he arrives at a building.

He was released on Christmas 2021 and can be played using the archer's green materials.

Each time the Santa Gor ends his move action on a space with a building, he may place any item from the merchant's inventory (except the witch's brew) on that space. That item can only be picked up by another hero. The Santa Gor can only place one item per building space.

Name: Space Rally
Description:
Take a seat in a spaceship and race through solar storms and asteroid fields to victory.

Each person controls a spaceship and tries to reach the finish line first over 3 stages.
But the opponents will not watch idly as you steer your spaceship smoothly across the finish line. They will literally put obstacles in your way: Asteroids.
So you'll have to shoot your way through the asteroids or navigate around them. However, asteroid fragments are rich in rare metals. If you collect the fragments during the race, you can exchange them for upgrades to your ship at the end of the stage. 
Besides, you'll have to contend with solar storms, which you should avoid in any case.

Pick up your dice, choose an action from your multi-use cards and fly to victory.

Will you be the first to reach the finish line and get fame and glory?
Find out in: Space Rally

–description from the designer

Name: Il gioco di Cattivik
Description: Cattivik and the rats have to go through the maze of the sewers in search of a loot, made up of different objects. But our characters get in the way of each other and the labyrinth changes its appearance at every turn and so it is not easy to find everything, get rid of the bad luck and return to the starting point: whoever succeeds first wins!

Name: The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada
Description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall: Omicidio sulla 168^ strada (Murder on 168th Street), a high school student, promising basketball player and very popular, is found dead along the road that every day took him from the field, where he trained early in the morning, to school.
He lived in a poor neighborhood, but everything points that it isn't just a simple robbery.

Name: The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori
Description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori, (Crime under the spotlights), a famous actor dies on the set of his last film because of a real bullet, loaded into a gun that had to shoot blanks, while shooting the last scene. How did this happen? In the show business nothing is as it seems and everyone has something to hide.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zoo Square
Description:
Zoo Square is a corner matching game that is visual challenging and addictively fun. It is designed for kids and adults who love zoo animals and into all kinds of crazy puzzles.

The goal of the game is to be the fastest player to finish a 4-card puzzle. Four cards are randomly drawn from the deck, and you will need to arrange and rotate the 4 square cards into a 2x2 grid, so that the dangerous animals (elephants, lions, and crocodiles) are grouped by their kind, and fenced off from the free-roaming peacocks and the rest of the zoo.

A solution to the puzzle must meet the following two criteria:
1) The center 4 spaces contain the same kind of animals.
2) Each of the edge groups (made out of 2 spaces each) contain the same kind of animals.

There are 2 game modes for beginner and advance level players.

Name: Forest Trails
Description:
As forest developer, your role is to improve the visitor experience and attract as many people as you can to come and enjoy the beautiful forest. How many visitors can you attract?

An engaging, role and write game where players will take on the roll of Forest Developer and design and map out interesting forest trails, take visitors past scenic view points and carry out surveys to find out what facilities visitors require to keep people coming back.

Game Play

Trail parts (start or end markers, paths etc) and the type of trail to draw are chosen from options revealed through 2 dice rolls. Map out trails that will appeal to 4 types of visitor (4 different coloured route types) and fit in as many trails as you can on your forest map.

Surveys of visitors along partly finished (or finished) trails will enable you to discover what visitors need and keep them coming back.

Reach a build point along your survey track and you can add a facility building. These attract even more visitors who you can survey again to improve facilities even more. Watch your score build up as you try to fit in up to three types of buildings for each path type. This engine building, puzzle system enables rewarding strategies to be discovered for higher points.

Points (visitor points) are earned by the length of trails, what building / facilities they have on them and what objectives have been met.

Discover new maps and new ways to optimize trails. Play as 1 of 4 different characters. Each character role, such as Forest Educator, has unique bonus abilities / actions, objectives and end game visitor bonus point achievements.

-description from designer

Name: My First Monopoly Game
Description:
My First Monopoly Game offers fun teaching tools for families. It features a double-sided game board with 2 levels of play.

Each level uses its own set of Monopoly money and cards, as well as rules. based on the classic Monopoly rules. Players still want to have the most money at the end of the game to win.

Name: Invaders
Description:
The Earth was attacked by the aliens and it is in danger! 
But, if you cooperate with each other, you can save it.

Invaders is a cooperative and memory-based game that is played in two phases:

     the "planning" one where you have to deploy your interceptors based on the aliens that are drawn at every turn
     the "invasion" one, where you check how well you did in the planning phase (and where you have few chances to correct your mistakes)


It contains 5 different difficulty levels, each introducing new material and rules.

—description from the designer

Name: The Wordbuilder Set
Description:
The Wordbuilder Set has two games for "onset and rime" [word beginnings and endings] practice.

Initial Blends SPRING

This has a deck of 64 cards, 2 each for 32 different 2-3 letter rimes (e.g. an, ack, ing, ock), and 2 dice which have a total of 12 2-letter onsets on them (e.g. br, tr, pl, st).  Players are dealt 7 cards each.  The dice are rolled and players try to match either of the onsets seen with one of the rimes on a card in hand, which is discarded if successful.  The first player to empty their hand wins.  There are two modes: taking turns and simultaneous play.

Wordbuilder

The deck has:
- 48 cards with both a word that can act as a rime (e.g. age, eat, ice, old), and 1-2 letter onset
- 8 joker cards, each with 6 different 1-2 letter onsets
- 8 YOU LOSE cards

Players are dealt 4-7 cards each, as agreed, and the dealer plays a word card from their hand. On their turn a player does one of these: 
- Play a word card. If there is another word card atop the discard pile, the new card's onset must make a valid word with the previous card's rime.
- Play a joker card, such that one of its onsets makes a word with the rime on a word card atop the discard pile. Then the player may play any other card except another joker.
- Play a YOU LOSE card, which makes the next player draw two cards and skip their turn. 
- Draw the top card of the deck. 
To go out and win the hand, a player must play a YOU LOSE card along with their final card. Otherwise, if they play their final card, they draw the top of the deck.

Name: Escape Game: Serial Killer
Description:
In the heart of London, innocent victims are at the mercy of a fearsome serial killer. Only you can save them. Investigate but watch out for time... the crime doesn't wait!

The Escape Room range is inspired by the Escape Room rooms. Find their incredible atmosphere at home! Go on an adventure, observe, manipulate and solve various puzzles that will put your logical mind to the test.

This Escape Game contains 8 scenarios of 60 minutes each.

Name: SHASN: Kickstarter Add-On Pack
Description:
Includes:

1 2-piece resource box
1 Edge of Chaos board
1 punch board for Home Turf, movable Volatile Zone, and IOU tokens
1 scenario book
1 SHASN comic book
13 Elite cards
12 Cost of Victory cards
5 drawstring bags for voter pegs

These items were not included with the retail version of the game.

Name: Die Legenden von Andor: Düstere Zeiten – Der Marsch der Trolle
Description:
Der Marsch der Trolle ("The march of the trolls") is an official free print & play legend for the expansion "Düstere Zeiten" to the base game Legends of Andor.

This tricky bonus legend is chronologically set between the second and the third Düstere Zeiten legend.

The heroes fight for the kingdom of Andor in the Troll Wars while trying to recover the two stolen shields of power. Their many opponents are lead by three big trolls.

Name: Pocket Landship
Description:
Pocket Landship is based on the print and play Board Game Geek Award nominated (2017) soloplay card wargame. In this version we see a steampunk theme and expanded gameplay with additional enemy and friendly options, as well as multiplayer options.

Command a Landship (the original British term for tanks) to clear a sector of enemy infantry, artillery, and enemy mech and alike.

The player chooses a Landship to control with weapons or support units to create either a single high powered Landship or a more disparate defending force, including a squad of shock troops.

The enemy appears as waves of enemy mech, artillery, infantry, and mine fields arranged in 2 rows of 3 cards.

Each turn, the player will roll 3 6-sided dice and assign each die to each of their cards to attack the enemies. Then, for the enemy turn, roll the 3 dice and assign them low to high left to right across the front enemy line, then take the assigned actions.

Each card has its own damage track. When a card is destroyed, it is removed from the game. Win by destroying all 9 enemy cards. Lose if the enemy destroys your landship.

-description from publisher

The black box version includes the Black Box (a bigger box) which will take sleeved cards. It also includes all the cards, dice and rule booklet from the standard version of Pocket Landship 2nd Edition (including the weather card and die) AND the cards from the 'No Man's Land' expansion.

The box will also have enough room for the sleeved versions of the Kickstarter exclusive cards unlocked during this campaign AND the 2 Driver KS Exclusive cards (which were available separately as an add-on) from the first KS.

Name: Psych! Party Game
Description:
OUTWIT YOUR FRIENDS
Make up fake answers to real trivia questions and score points when you psych out your friends in this hilarious party game based on the popular app.

BRING TO YOUR NEXT PARTY
Choose a category and read the question, make up an answer and pin it to the board, then wait and see who you psyched out. Win even more points if you pick the right answer.

4 FUN CATEGORIES
Features 4 different categories for you to psych out your friends: Is That A Fact, Word Up, Movie Bluff and The Truth Comes Out. Shuffle them all together for a more random game.

Includes: 1 Gameboard, 2 Paper Pads, 200 Cards, 1 Magnetic Pin Board, 8 Movers, 1 Magnet Sheet, 1 Sticker Sheet, Instructions.

Name: Lumen Void
Description:
Game- A Score and Reset Hand Management Game involving a process of discarding and drawing cards to complete sets and combos with the objective of achieving the highest point values. The Players of the game collect creatures, anatomy, and valuable information as they gain experience points playing this exciting new sci-fi adventure card game!

Story- Experience the thrill of being a Voider on Mission Scorpius! Enter an unusual scientific realm where knowledge is the key to survival, and beware of the space creatures lurking within the unknown territory of the Lumen Void. Much is to be discovered from the unique space monsters to astronomical events (Expansion packs) but only those who gain the most experience will have what it takes to survive.

—description from the designer

Name: Scott Pilgrim Miniatures The World: Expansion Box
Description:
This expansion box includes the additional battles against Evil Exs #2-7!
Includes components for the following:
Lucus Lee Battle Expansion 
Todd Ingram Battle Expansion 
Roxie Richter Battle Expansions
Katayanagi Twins Battle Expansion
Gideon Graves Battle Expansion

Scott Pilgrim Miniatures the World is a competitive board game where one team takes on the role of Scott and the other Good Guys to fight against the League of Evil Exes. Each character has unique powers, and as they battle, they will level up and unlock new special abilities. The action takes place on a pop-up board with large detailed miniatures, custom dice, and 3D constructible objects for smashing and throwing!

Name: Infinity: Raveneye
Description:
The assault on the Raveneye Orbital Complex, a defensive military compound disguised as a communications relay station, has been the key to opening the way for the Morat Aggression Forces’ deployment in the Durgama region, and has furthered the Combined Army’s conquests on Concilium Prima, the political heart of the Human Sphere. What could possibly be so important to the almighty leader of the Combined Army? Or could it be just another smokescreen to divert the attention of the Concilium Coordinated Command?

The book “Infinity: Raveneye” is an expansion for Infinity that broadens its universe and background, focusing on the Military Orders of PanOceania, Ariadna’s Kosmoflot and its new territory of Khurland, the Nomad mothership Corregidor, and the Morat Aggression Forces of the Combined Army, as well as mercenaries for NA2. It also includes three narrative scenarios that recreate the assault on this orbital station, which can be played as a campaign or independently, in addition to painting tutorials for the Military Orders’ Crosiers, Corregidor’s Intruders, Kosmoflot’s Para-Commandos, and Morat’s Vanguard Infantry. Connect now and lead your elite force into the most dangerous war zones of the Human Sphere!
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Skellington
Description:
Skellington is a may-follow trick-taker played with dominoes. The relative strength of the suits may change from trick-to-trick but the players’ choices will dictate how the strength will change.

You can play any tile you wish, in whichever orientation is best. Each tile is worth the difference from its highest number to its lowest number (e.g., a 6-1 tile is worth 5 tile points).

There are 71 tile points to capture each round (a bonus tile point is awarded to the last trick winner). However, only the side that takes the majority of these points will score victory points.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Shogun Dynasty
Description:
Shogun Dynasty is a fast and fast paced card game of different clans in Japan struggling to take power over all Japan as the Shogun.  Using only 20 cards, it is extremely portable and can be played almost anywhere.

Shogun Dynasty is played as a series of games.  Players are knocked out of a game until the winner is determined.  The winner of the series is the first to win 3 games or to win a game with the Emperor.

Players have a hand of one card.  On their turn they draw one card and play one of their two cards, keeping the other as their hand.

Cards can be played face up or face down, with different effects.  Cards played face up take effect immediately.  Cards played face down take effect at the start of the player's next turn.  And players may discard the face down cards of other players before they take effect.

Card effects may knock a player out of the game.  At the end of the game, the remaining player with the highest ranking card in their hand wins.

-description from designer

Name: Crimewave: California
Description:
Sun, surf, sand… and serial killers. It’s 1970-something in California, hippy culture is rife, things are getting groovy, and serial murders are at their peak. Public panic is high but arrests are still low, so you and your fellow investigators (or just a bunch of friends) have been tasked with solving these heinous crimes.

Crimewave: California is a hidden movement co-op game. Players choose to play as one of the investigator roles or take on the task of controlling the three criminals.

One player operates as all three killers, who reside in secret locations across the board. On each turn, that player places down crime scenes to try and increase public panic and outsmart the investigators.

On their turn, investigators will move around the board in an effort to locate the killers' residences. Their goal is to work together to find out where the killers are residing by piecing together crime scenes. Investigators also roll dice to try and verify evidence at different crime scenes, which they'll use during the trial phase.

When the investigators successfully take the killers to trial, they go into a courtroom face-off and play defense and prosecution cards to try and increase and decrease their own score.

The winner is the player with the highest card score at the end of the trial. For the investigators, the way to win the game is to jail all three killers. Alternatively, if the public panic marker reaches 10 before the killers are jailed, the player controlling all three killers wins the game.

Name: Kletterranke
Description:
Deep in the Amazon rainforest, a small people live on a rocky plateau, far from any civilisation.

Only a huge climbing vine - called Pi`i Pua by the inhabitants, the "climbing flower" - connects their village to the ground.

Every year, a group of young hunters is sent into the jungle to hunt. Who will be the first to climb the climbing vine that leads back to the village and thus receive the honour of asking for the hand of the chief's daughter?

The aim is to play the cards as well as possible in each round and to reach the home village as quickly as possible. In the process, however, attention must also be paid to other people, because everyone wants to climb the mighty climbing flower first.

How do you climb the vine?

Everyone gets a certain number of cards in their hand at the beginning. The rest become the draw pile. The starting card is placed in the middle of the table, the target card four edges above it.

When it is your turn, you choose from one of three possible actions:

When climbing, you place a card from your hand on edge against the vine and move up as many spaces as indicated on the card (or even less).

You can jump over your climbing opponents, but you must never be on the same field.

Make sure that at least one transition fits, otherwise you might have taken the wrong turn ...

If you decide with the second option that you would rather just explore the area, draw a card from the draw pile and move one space further.

As a last option, you can also cut the vine. To do this, you take a card from the draw pile into your hand. Of course, you only do this if there is no one on the card at the time. In addition, another card must not completely lose the connection.

If you are on a card with a flower during the game, you can perform two actions in your turn.

You can use a beetle card to replace a card that is already on the table, which then goes under the draw pile.

You cannot cross over beetle cards, so use them cleverly to block each other's way. By capping them, you can always use them somewhere else.

The first of you to reach one of the target fields has not only earned the respect of the entire tribe, but may also ask for the hand of the chief's daughter.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: AdvenTourist: Természeti kincseink
Description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary. This time, you will focus on natural values: hills, lakes etc.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like hiking trails, historical places) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

Name: Terraforming Mars: Merger Promo Card
Description:
This is the summer 2022 promo card.

Merger is a Prelude card that lets you draw 4 Corporations, play one of them and discard the other 3. Then you pay 42 M€.

Promo card X41

So you get a second Corporation.

Name: Inferno: Card Game
Description:
Inferno is an “anti-pick up” styled survival strategy card game. The aim is to be the last surviving player, to do this you will need to collect cards to help you avoid negative events. By picking up cards, it also increases your chance of encountering dangerous events. The cards which help you navigate the deck do not only help you avoid danger, but can strategically place your opponents into danger.

Their demise is your survival. 
There can only be one survivor!

—description from the designer

Name: Longboard: Surf's Up Promo Pack
Description:
Promo pack featuring 7 new cards: 3 objectives and 4 beach scenes.

The three objectives are:
Twin Fin (4 pts) - Two boards with identical values.
Shortboard (3pts) - Board with no number over 5. 
Hang Ten (3 pts) - Board with 10 cards.

There are 4 beach background cards consisting of two different designs.

Available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: War Comes Early: Czechoslovakia 1938
Description:
War Comes Early (WCE) is a low to intermediate complexity two-player alternative history wargame. It investigates the parameters of the six weeks of the conflict that would have resulted had the Czechoslovakians refused to accept the Munich Agreement. Had they been willing to fight the Soviets were pledged to come to their aid as fully and directly as possible. That intervention would have immediately escalated the crisis beyond a Czech German one and into the realm of a major war. The game is restricted to covering the hypothetical war’s first six weeks in October and the first half of November. That is because none of the participants had the logistical wherewithal to to go on fighting longer than that without a pause to resupply.

—descriptions from the publisher

Name: The Crimean Campaign
Description:
The Crimean Campaign, 1941 -42 (TCC) is a strategic level two-player wargame (with strong operational undertones) of low-intermediate complexity covering the fighting across the peninsula that climaxed with the German capture of Sevastopol.

The action simulated in the game took place historically between 28 October 1941 and 4 July 1942. The first date marks the German entry into the Crimea via the Perekop Isthmus, while the second marks the end of organized Soviet resistance across the whole peninsula. Those nine calendar months are divided into chronologically varied and unequal numbers of turns. That approach allows for the convenient simulation of the ebbs and flows in the action that took place due to bad weather and logistical and command-control constraints.

The Perekop Isthmus fight, which took place from 24 September through 27 October, just off-map to the north, is not included in the game because it took place across terrain too restrictive to allow for maneuver by either side. At this scale it would have come down to how lucky the German player got in rolling his inescapably low-range and mid-range initial frontal attacks. So that episode is considered to have taken place as the last act of the Dniepr River campaign rather than the first act in the Crimean campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Great European War
Description:
Great European War is a Strategic level two-player wargame of an alternative World War II in Europe, based on the premise that Adolf Hitler did not order the invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941. Instead, the Axis goes over to a naval-air offensive against the British with additional operations in North Africa and the Middle East, while waiting for America to enter the war and keeping a watchful eye on Stalin who may intervene.

The game assumes that the Western Allies decide on a Europe First Strategy, diverting forces and logistics from the Pacific. The Axis is under pressure to win the war before economic collapse sets in, the Allies to win before the Japanese seize too much of the Pacific. Given the shift in Axis logistics and planning against the British Empire and the US. only the westernmost Soviet Union is shown on the map, but there is emphasis on North Africa and the Middle East.

There are two players: Axis and Allied (to include the Western Allies and the Soviet Union). Both players can develop orders of battle by expending Mobilization Points. The game shows the war in Europe during the early and mid-war years before the full Allied buildup. Both sides will be fighting a war which is markedly different from that fought in the historical event. The game ends in 1943, the time when the Western Allies originally planned to return to Europe.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Taierzhuang
Description:
The Battle of Taierzhuang: Covers the fighting that climaxed in the first (failed) Japanese offensive of 1938 in China.

Each hex on the map represents .25 miles or .4km. Each game turn represents two days. Units of maneuver are Japanese infantry battalions and tank companies; and Chinese regiments.

22 x 34-inch game map with both battles; Stalin’s First Victory 48 5/8-inch counters; Taierzhuang 128 5/8-inch counters.

Taierzhuang / Stalin's First Victory were both published in World at War #91, June 2023

—description from the publisher

Name: アメノキリフダ (Heavenly Trump)
Description:
In ã‚¢ãƒ¡ãƒŽã‚­ãƒªãƒ•ãƒ€ (Ameno Kirifuda), players play a trick-taking game where the winner of a trick places a chip on a 4x4 grid in the row corresponding to the suit of the card they played.

The suits of the cards represent the seasons, and the trump mechanism used is that the lead suit is subordinate to the "next season".

In addition to the cards used to take tricks, players draft cards which will grant points based upon having chips in certain suit patterns on the board.  Players also earn points for having chips on the board, regardless of these cards.

The game lasts for two rounds and the person with the most points wins.

Name: Torre Alta
Description:
Torre Alta is an introductory-level hex and counter wargame, set in a fictional European medieval kingdom. Players take on the role of princes fighting for the throne of their dying father, the king.
Published in Espaço T Magazine, a general interest Portuguese magazine from the 1980s, as a detachable cut and mount game.

Name: The Game of BUFFALO
Description:
Any number of persons can play the Game, from two up. The mode of playing the Game with but two Players is different than when played by three or more.

It will be seen that the Deck is composed of Books consisting of four Cards each, and the name of the Book is indicated by the center line in large type on all four Cards constituting any one book. The top line of each Card indicates which particular Card that Card is of a certain book. The three bottom names on each Card indicate, for the convenience of the Player, what the names or top lines of the other Cards composing that particular Book are.

The object in a game is for a Player to acquire all the Cards composing any one Book. When he has accomplished this he places the four Cards on the table before him to be counted as one trick at the end of the Game, unless he shall lose said Book in the manner described in the following rules.

Name: Splito: Goodie 42
Description:
The back of this card is an additional common objective, added at the start of the game alongside the other two.

When at the end of a round the sum of the Splito cards of an area reaches exactly 42, this objective is placed in the area in question.
It is definitively validated and the area can receive other Splito cards.

If several areas reach this amount at the same time, this objective is discarded.

Name: Storm over Arnhem: The Crossing
Description:
Published in Vol. 19, Issue #1 of the Avalon Hill magazine "General".

This expansion/variant uses new units ALREADY supplied in the game but not used in the published scenarios.

From the intro article:

"This article is undoubtedly a first in wargame publication history. Never before, at least in our recollection, has a game been published with all the parts necessary for a variant style of play except the rules..."
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Genius Gems
Description:
Each player receives their own Genius Gems grid and a set of the ten, double-sided clusters of gems. Roll five of the dice inside the shaker and they will land in the five coloured wells. Now race your opponent to fill every space on the grid using the ten clusters, so that the patterns shown on the dice appear simultaneously on the grid, in the correct colours.

All 10,794 puzzles have at least one possible solution. As soon as somebody finishes first, re-roll the dice and play again! Will you stick to using the basic dice, or up the ante and include the dastardly and/or devilish dice?

There may be times when it seems impossible, but there will ALWAYS be at least one solution... and that’s what makes it a ‘Genius’ game!

Name: Henchman
Description:
A light, fast-playing card game for 2-6 players featuring player interaction, some backstabbing, and a healthy dose of humor. Picture the office meets Sword & Sorcery.  Work for an Evil Overlord—a tyrannical, ruthless, megalomaniacal villain bent on world domination. launch an epic competition of subterfuge, deceit, and backstabbing to prove who is most worthy to become the next Henchman!

A modified deck builder with the entire deck building mechanic occurring at the beginning of the game. Players choose from the 6 minion characters each with their own advantages and natural skills.
The game begins with the Minion Working Phase which is divided in rounds. Each round is split into a series of  steps for each minion to complete: assign tasks, initialize time, demonstrate skills, complete tasks and refresh hands to earn points, skills and reputation. One player acts as the MIC (Minion in Charge) and uses the task deck to indicate status. This is the time to demonstrate delegation and negotiation skills to curry favor with the Evil Overlord (EO).

The MIC draws a number of tasks equal to the number of minions under their delegation. The MIC then hands out these tasks to minions as they see fit for them to complete, managing time. Any tasks not completed will an increase to the Evil Overlord Annoyance tracker (the EO has no tolerance for minions who cannot complete simple tasks!) Any tasks the MIC chooses not to complete will cost them time and points as will any failed tasks by minions. Be careful your minions could choose to strategize against you to become the next MIC. Minions complete tasks to demonstrate skills, gain abilities, points and reputation in attempt to take over as the next MIC to get their chance to please the EO and become the henchman.

The game ends if there are not enough tasks to assign to  minions including reshuffled tasks. The minion that has gained the most reputation points earns the respect of the Evil Overlord and is declared the Henchman and the winner of the game.

Name: The Rugrats Movie Board Game
Description: The aim of the game is to proceed around the board by rolling dice. The first one to reach the "Hospical" is the winner!

Name: Everest Challenge
Description:
Spin for your chance to make it to the top first. Use teamwork to find the best way up but watch out, a fall is only a spin away

Players have two different climbers with pegs in their feet. They spin a spinner and climb up the side of the mountain but watch out! Their is only room for one climber in each peg so your opponent can very quickly knock you out! First to have both climbers to the top wins.

—user summary

Name: Guinness World Records: Marble Challenge
Description:
Can you move a record breaking number of marbles using chopsticks in one minute?

In the game, players take turns moving marbles from the game box to an adjacent bowl using only chopsticks. Players take turns trying to reach the highest score possible. Can you break the world record?

Name: Squadrons: Star Citizen Strategy Card Game
Description:
Squadrons is an immersive strategy collectable card game which lets you command your favourite ships from the Star Citizen universe and compete with other players both in duel and multiplayer matches.

Squadrons is very catchy and beginner-friendly, but with increasing game experience it offers a very multi-faceted game.

The resource system was deliberately minimized with a focus on tactical action, rousing space battles and dogfights.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sonderburger Seeschlacht-Spiel
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the harbor of Sonderburg (space 100) wins the game.

Plastic sailships were available as supplements to bags of Harry-Sonderburger bread.

Name: 1:0 für Babette
Description: The players move the ball on the game board according to the results of a spinning top (with results from 1 to 6). When a player loses control of the ball, the other player gets his turn. After a predetermined time the player with the most goals wins the game.
